info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 14 at 1:32PM PDT until July 17 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SATURDAY TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures of 90 to near 100 degrees may be observed this weekend across the mountain areas in Central California. * WHERE...Yosemite NP outside of the valley, Upper San Joaquin River, Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge, Kings Canyon NP, Grant Grove Area, Sequoia NP and South End of the Upper Sierra. Mainly elevations up to 7,000 feet. * WHEN...From 11 AM Saturday to 8 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous heat will result in a minor to moderate risk for heat-related illnesses for some in the population, especially those who are extremely heat sensitive and those without adequate hydration.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
